001package squidpony.squidai.astar;
002
003import squidpony.Maker;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
005import squidpony.squidmath.Arrangement;
006import squidpony.squidmath.Coord;
007
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.List;
011
012public class DefaultGraph implements Graph<Coord> {
013
014    /**
015     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing twice as
016     * much as orthogonal movement. This is a good choice for graphs where only four-way movement is used.
017     */
018    public static final Heuristic<Coord> MANHATTAN = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
019        @Override
020        public float estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
021            return Math.abs(node.x - endNode.x) + Math.abs(node.y - endNode.y);
022        }
023    };
024    /**
025     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing the same as
026     * orthogonal movement. This is only suggested for graphs where eight-way movement is used, and it may produce
027     * erratic paths compared to {@link #EUCLIDEAN}.
028     */
029    public static final Heuristic<Coord> CHEBYSHEV = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
030        @Override
031        public float estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
032            return Math.max(Math.abs(node.x - endNode.x), Math.abs(node.y - endNode.y));
033        }
034    };
035    /**
036     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where all movement is calculated "as-the-crow-flies," using
037     * the standard Pythagorean formula for distance as in the real world. This does not make diagonal connections, if
038     * they are allowed, actually cost more or less, but they won't be preferred if an orthogonal route can be taken.
039     * This is recommended for graphs where eight-way movement is used.
040     */
041    public static final Heuristic<Coord> EUCLIDEAN = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
042        @Override
043        public float estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
044            return (float) node.distance(endNode);
045        }
046    };
047    /**
048     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where the heuristic is not used, and all cells are
049     * considered equivalent regardless of actual distance.
050     */
051    public static final Heuristic<Coord> DIJKSTRA = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
052        @Override
053        public float estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
054            return 1f;
055        }
056    };
057
058    public static final List<Heuristic<Coord>> HEURISTICS = Collections.unmodifiableList(Maker.makeList(MANHATTAN, CHEBYSHEV, EUCLIDEAN, DIJKSTRA));
059    
060    public Arrangement<Coord> positions;
061    public ArrayList<List<Connection<Coord>>> allConnections;
062    public int width;
063    public int height;
064
065    /**
066     * Creates an empty DefaultGraph with capacity 16; you must call {@link #init(char[][], boolean)} or
067     * otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it. The capacity is expected to resize to fit a
068     * typically-much-larger map.
069     */
070    public DefaultGraph() {
071        this(16);
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Creates an empty DefaultGraph with the given minimum capacity; you must call {@link #init(char[][], boolean)} or
076     * otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it.
077     * @param capacity how many nodes, approximately, to expect in the map
078     */
079    public DefaultGraph(int capacity) {
080        positions = new Arrangement<>(capacity);
081        allConnections = new ArrayList<>(capacity);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(char[][], boolean)}, with eightWay set
086     * to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
087     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
088     */
089    public DefaultGraph(char[][] map)
090    {
091        this(map, false);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(char[][], boolean)}.
096     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
097     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
098     */
099    public DefaultGraph(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
100    {
101        this(map.length * map[0].length * 3 >> 2); // 3/4 of the map could maybe be walkable; more is rare
102        init(map, eightWay);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called
107     * more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store
108     * the ones in the latest map. The {@code map} should use {@code #} for walls and impassable areas; all other chars
109     * will be considered equally passable.
110     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
111     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
112     */
113    public void init(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
114    {
115        width = map.length;
116        height = map[0].length;
117        Coord.expandPoolTo(width, height);
118        positions.clear();
119        allConnections.clear();
120        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
121            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
122                if(map[i][j] != '#')
123                    positions.add(Coord.get(i, j));
124            }
125        }
126        final Direction[] dirs = eightWay ? Direction.CLOCKWISE : Direction.CARDINALS_CLOCKWISE;
127        final int size = positions.size(), dirCount = dirs.length;
128        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
129            Coord c = positions.keyAt(i);
130            ArrayList<Connection<Coord>> list = new ArrayList<>(dirCount);
131            for(Direction dir : dirs)
132            {
133                Coord offset = c.translate(dir);
134                if(positions.containsKey(offset))
135                    list.add(new DefaultConnection<Coord>(c, offset));
136            }
137            allConnections.add(list);
138        }
139    }
140    
141    /**
142     * Returns the connections outgoing from the given node.
143     *
144     * @param fromNode the node whose outgoing connections will be returned
145     * @return the array of connections outgoing from the given node.
146     */
147    @Override
148    public List<Connection<Coord>> getConnections(Coord fromNode) {
149        return allConnections.get(positions.getInt(fromNode));
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Returns the unique index of the given node.
154     *
155     * @param node the node whose index will be returned
156     * @return the unique index of the given node.
157     */
158    @Override
159    public int getIndex(Coord node) {
160        return positions.getInt(node);
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Returns the number of nodes in this graph.
165     */
166    @Override
167    public int getNodeCount() {
168        return positions.size();
169    }
170    
171    public StringBuilder show(StringBuilder sb, Pathfinder<Coord> pathfinder, Pathfinder.Metrics metrics) {
172        int len = (int)Math.log10(Math.round(metrics.maxCost)) + 1;
173        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
174            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) { 
175                Coord c = Coord.get(x, y);
176                int index = positions.getInt(c);
177                Pathfinder.NodeRecord<Coord> nr;
178                if(index < 0 || (nr = pathfinder.getNodeRecord(c)).category == Pathfinder.UNVISITED) {
179                    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
180                        sb.append('#');
181                    }
182                }
183                else {
184                    int cost = Math.round(nr.costSoFar);
185                    if(cost == 0)
186                    {
187                        for (int i = 1; i < len; i++) {
188                            sb.append(' ');
189                        }
190                        sb.append('0');
191                    }
192                    else {
193                        int used = len - (int) Math.log10(cost) - 1;
194                        for (int i = 0; i < used; i++) {
195                            sb.append(' ');
196                        }
197                        sb.append(cost);
198                    }
199                }
200                sb.append(' ');
201            }
202            if(y + 1 < height) 
203                sb.append('\n');
204        }
205        return sb;
206    }
207}
